# Feedback for “Insights”\#69

[New issue](https://github.com/login?return_to=https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/69)

Copy link

[New issue](https://github.com/login?return_to=https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/69)

Copy link

Open

Open

[Feedback for “Insights”](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/69#top)#69

Copy link

[![@catliaw](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/13739415?u=c49ad287aa6bbc0226dba91d50704b9457d8c1e3&v=4&size=80)](https://github.com/catliaw)

## Description

[![@catliaw](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/13739415?u=c49ad287aa6bbc0226dba91d50704b9457d8c1e3&v=4&size=48)](https://github.com/catliaw)

[catliaw](https://github.com/catliaw)

opened [on May 4, 2023](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/69#issue-1696502582)

Screenshots showing the query builder are slightly outdated. They still show the "+ Metric" under the query block, instead of the "+" button on the top right. Perhaps should wait until the new counting menu is released to take new screenshots and GIFs.

Some screenshots also have a shadow from the Mac navigation bar, so make sure to resize the window out of the shadow zone before taking a screenshot.

## Activity

# Incorrect info for global filtering (post-query) Funnels\#306

[New issue](https://github.com/login?return_to=https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/306)

Copy link

[New issue](https://github.com/login?return_to=https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/306)

Copy link

Open

Open

[Incorrect info for global filtering (post-query) Funnels](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/306#top)#306

Copy link

[![@julianneb-mixpanel](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/100325677?v=4&size=80)](https://github.com/julianneb-mixpanel)

## Description

[![@julianneb-mixpanel](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/100325677?v=4&size=48)](https://github.com/julianneb-mixpanel)

[julianneb-mixpanel](https://github.com/julianneb-mixpanel)

opened [on Jul 3, 2023](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/306#issue-1786614812)

[Global Filtering section](https://docs.mixpanel.com/docs/analysis/reports/funnels#global-filtering-post-query) is incorrect/ outdated. It doesn't mention property attribution, which is how the filter is applied. Rather, it is explained based on all of the events needing to qualify with a given filter value.

## Activity

# missing initial\_utm\_parameters from default properties doc\#436

[New issue](https://github.com/login?return_to=https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/436)

Copy link

[New issue](https://github.com/login?return_to=https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/436)

Copy link

Open

Open

[missing initial\_utm\_parameters from default properties doc](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/436#top)#436

Copy link

[![@caracheng](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/6516476?v=4&size=80)](https://github.com/caracheng)

## Description

[![@caracheng](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/6516476?v=4&size=48)](https://github.com/caracheng)

[caracheng](https://github.com/caracheng)

opened [on Aug 11, 2023](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/436#issue-1847134900)

In this [document](https://docs.mixpanel.com/docs/tracking/how-tos/tracking-utm-tags#utm-properties), we mention that:

> Mixpanel's Javascript library will also track initial\_utm\_parameters as a profile property, based on the first ever visit. This is helpful as if a user makes a purchase or completes some other important event, it is important to know want to know what acquisition channel brought them to your site originally.

However, in the [default properties doc for Web,](https://docs.mixpanel.com/docs/tracking/reference/default-properties#user-properties) we don't include the initial\_ utm\_parameters that we track by default in the table.

We should update the table to reflect that we do track this info by default as profile properties

## Activity

[![ranic](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/2077899?u=e87ccad0ab600da2e22c57d7eb232d40c36dde67&v=4&size=80)](https://github.com/ranic)

### ranic commented on Aug 17, 2023

[![@ranic](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/2077899?u=e87ccad0ab600da2e22c57d7eb232d40c36dde67&v=4&size=48)](https://github.com/ranic)

[ranic](https://github.com/ranic)

[on Aug 17, 2023](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/436#issuecomment-1682490733)

Contributor

[@caracheng](https://github.com/caracheng) \-\- do you mind making a PR to add this?

# Missing documentation regarding e-commerce payload for cart analysis\#778

[New issue](https://github.com/login?return_to=https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/778)

Copy link

[New issue](https://github.com/login?return_to=https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/778)

Copy link

Open

Open

[Missing documentation regarding e-commerce payload for cart analysis](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/778#top)#778

Copy link

[![@adamribaudo-velir](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/71573504?u=7669ecd273047b7903992dcc47ff5e98791909b3&v=4&size=80)](https://github.com/adamribaudo-velir)

## Description

[![@adamribaudo-velir](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/71573504?u=7669ecd273047b7903992dcc47ff5e98791909b3&v=4&size=48)](https://github.com/adamribaudo-velir)

[adamribaudo-velir](https://github.com/adamribaudo-velir)

opened [on Jan 3, 2024](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/778#issue-2064046324)

There is no documentation indicating the event payload necessary to support cart analysis.

It's not mentioned under [data structures](https://docs.mixpanel.com/docs/data-structure/events-and-properties), the [javascript sdk docs](https://docs.mixpanel.com/docs/tracking-methods/sdks/javascript), or in the e-com [tracking plan](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Kyys37m_GEL79_1BKKEnU5KxK91NF04kY-L_bFfcfqE/edit#gid=1641519238).

The only code I see referenced is in this image from the [cart analysis](https://docs.mixpanel.com/changelogs/2023-06-16-cart-analysis) page.

## Activity

## Description

[![@lcjdot](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/19153553?u=b4220e0e0977ef4d555d8d5264c6b06e7a9aec5d&v=4&size=48)](https://github.com/lcjdot)

[lcjdot](https://github.com/lcjdot)

opened [on Jul 30, 2024](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/1284#issue-2438623222)

Current **package.json** inline code:

```notranslate
{
  "dependencies": {
    "@google-cloud/functions-framework": "^3.0.0",
    "mixpanel": "^0.17.0",
		"google-ads-api": "^13.0.0"
  }
}

```

Both google-cloud/functions-framework and google-ads-api versions are out-of-date and breaking the integration.

The **package.json** inline code section of the **ad-spend** document should look like this:

```notranslate
{
  "dependencies": {
    "@google-cloud/functions-framework": "^3.4.2",
    "mixpanel": "^0.17.0",
		"google-ads-api": "^16.0.0"
  }
}

```

## Activity

# No static version of OpenAPI schemas\#711

[New issue](https://github.com/login?return_to=https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/711)

Copy link

[New issue](https://github.com/login?return_to=https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/711)

Copy link

Open

Open

[No static version of OpenAPI schemas](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/711#top)#711

Copy link

[![@vfragosop](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/68680?u=12691d435c4303c81058de63fea60f645cddf878&v=4&size=80)](https://github.com/vfragosop)

## Description

[![@vfragosop](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/68680?u=12691d435c4303c81058de63fea60f645cddf878&v=4&size=48)](https://github.com/vfragosop)

[vfragosop](https://github.com/vfragosop)

opened [on Nov 16, 2023](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/711#issue-1997094513) · edited by [vfragosop](https://github.com/vfragosop)

Edits

Hello!

Before [#648](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/pull/648), the final OpenAPI schemas were available on the repository and we could use them to generate clients locally. Now, there's no easily accessible way to generate clients without cloning mixpanel/docs locally.

The only way I could find to obtain the final schema was to:

1. I've inspected the code on [developer.mixpanel.com](https://developer.mixpanel.com/) and figured you are using [readme.com](https://readme.com/).
2. After a lot of searching and inspecting [readmeio/api](https://github.com/readmeio/api), I found they have a [public API for their schema registry](https://docs.readme.com/main/reference/getapiregistry).
3. Then I could use it with the UUIDs that I found on [developer.mixpanel.com](https://developer.mixpanel.com/), such as `2svd701elonb7h75`.

Although this works fine for customers using [readmeio/api](https://github.com/readmeio/api), there are other (and better) libraries such as [openapi-typescript](https://github.com/drwpow/openapi-typescript) that are not published by [readme.com](https://readme.com/) and also rely on the final OpenAPI schema.

Is it possible to have the final API schemas published somewhere, or including links to them on [developer.mixpanel.com](https://developer.mixpanel.com/)?

## Activity

# JS Quickstart\#237

[New issue](https://github.com/login?return_to=https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/237)

Copy link

[New issue](https://github.com/login?return_to=https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/237)

Copy link

Open

Open

[JS Quickstart](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/237#top)#237

Copy link

[![@kathmath](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/6914243?u=4e31679d23075f2733147ebedf720a02bf98a441&v=4&size=80)](https://github.com/kathmath)

## Description

[![@kathmath](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/6914243?u=4e31679d23075f2733147ebedf720a02bf98a441&v=4&size=48)](https://github.com/kathmath)

[kathmath](https://github.com/kathmath)

opened [on Jun 8, 2023](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/237#issue-1748083399)

In the [web quickstart](https://docs.mixpanel.com/docs/tracking/javascript-quickstart#step-2-track-your-first-event) for tracking your first event we tell people to init, identify, then track. Including identify isn't necessary to track an event and doesn't make sense in the case of anon activity and could cause confusion on id mgmt - I think it should be removed or clarified it's not req'd unless the user is identified. Other guides for [mobile](https://docs.mixpanel.com/docs/tracking/mobile) just have init + track.

## Activity

[![ranic](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/2077899?u=e87ccad0ab600da2e22c57d7eb232d40c36dde67&v=4&size=80)](https://github.com/ranic)

### ranic commented on Jun 8, 2023

[![@ranic](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/2077899?u=e87ccad0ab600da2e22c57d7eb232d40c36dde67&v=4&size=48)](https://github.com/ranic)

[ranic](https://github.com/ranic)

[on Jun 8, 2023](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/237#issuecomment-1583925209)

Contributor

Challenge is that if you want to track a "Signup" event, it _is_ required (because that's non-anonymous).

Maybe we can add a comment above `.identify()` that says something like "// Remove this if the user is anonymous" or something?

[![kathmath](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/6914243?u=4e31679d23075f2733147ebedf720a02bf98a441&v=4&size=80)](https://github.com/kathmath)

### kathmath commented on Jun 13, 2023

[![@kathmath](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/6914243?u=4e31679d23075f2733147ebedf720a02bf98a441&v=4&size=48)](https://github.com/kathmath)

[kathmath](https://github.com/kathmath)

[on Jun 13, 2023](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/237#issuecomment-1589690531)

ContributorAuthor

totally fair. as i'm thinking more about it this might be a broader thing to consider. we're using signup in most of the quickstart guides except http (but in mobile we don't include identify) for consistency i'm assuming. but then in the ref docs we're all over the place with event naming and the [JS ref example](https://docs.mixpanel.com/docs/tracking/reference/javascript#sending-events) isn't an authentication event. maybe in quickstart guides we can show sending both an anon event and auth event. I'd challenge using signup across the board in these - ofc you can track business critical events like signup, purchase, etc client side but it's a bit at odds with our usual recommendation to track these server-side for [safety](https://docs.mixpanel.com/docs/getting-started/plan-your-implementation#need-to-start-tracking-product-data).

[Sign up for free](https://github.com/signup?return_to=https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/237)**to join this conversation on GitHub.** Already have an account? [Sign in to comment](https://github.com/login?return_to=https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/237)

Copy link

[![@RNG-Tank](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/67986915?v=4&size=80)](https://github.com/RNG-Tank)

## Description

[![@RNG-Tank](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/67986915?v=4&size=48)](https://github.com/RNG-Tank)

[RNG-Tank](https://github.com/RNG-Tank)

opened [on Sep 12, 2023](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/514#issue-1892037743)

Hi guys, we are using iOS and Android SDK, and we hope to dynamically enable or disable the SDK when the app is running.

Is there any API?

If not, are there any plans for support it in the future?

# Feedback for "Funnels"\#79

[New issue](https://github.com/login?return_to=https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/79)

[Feedback for "Funnels"](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/79#top)#79

Copy link

[![@dorothy-koh](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/126842177?v=4&size=80)](https://github.com/dorothy-koh)

## Description

[![@dorothy-koh](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/126842177?v=4&size=48)](https://github.com/dorothy-koh)

[dorothy-koh](https://github.com/dorothy-koh)

opened [on May 4, 2023](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/79#issue-1696512638)

Under [https://docs-mixpanel.vercel.app/docs/analysis/reports/funnels#ordering](https://docs-mixpanel.vercel.app/docs/analysis/reports/funnels#ordering),

> Mixpanel will not count this as a full conversion

If we are to differentiate between a "full conversion" and a "partial conversion" then we should specify in each example if a user is partially or fully converted. However, not sure if this is confusing since this concept was not previously laid out.

## Activity

## Description

[![@egaebel-mixpanel](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/146760021?u=5ccab6f06a6906e2fd57d55e9c00b64b18083106&v=4&size=48)](https://github.com/egaebel-mixpanel)

opened [on Apr 26, 2024](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/1026#issue-2266295115)

[![@hamirmahal](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/43425812?u=36a1683bc710e44b2a65eacf08f4a06c030932f4&v=4&size=80)](https://github.com/hamirmahal)

## Description

[![@hamirmahal](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/43425812?u=36a1683bc710e44b2a65eacf08f4a06c030932f4&v=4&size=48)](https://github.com/hamirmahal)

[hamirmahal](https://github.com/hamirmahal)

opened [on Dec 14, 2024](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/issues/1683#issue-2740170826)

[`pages/docs/tracking-methods/integrations/amazon-s3.md`](https://github.com/mixpanel/docs/blob/main/pages/docs/tracking-methods/integrations/amazon-s3.md) says ["Set the runtime to `python 3.7`."](https://docs.mixpanel.com/docs/tracking-methods/integrations/amazon-s3)

[`python 3.7` is no longer available](https://us-east-2.console.aws.amazon.com/lambda/home?region=us-east-2#/create/function).
